title: naatu_naatu
body:
Telugu-language song from the Indian movie [i][[RRR (movie)|]][/i], translated roughly as "native," "local," or "wild." The song and its hook step dance from its music video were so popular even outside India, it won Golden Globe Award for Best Original Song and the Oscar (Academy Award) for Best Original Song, the first Indian-language song from an Indian film, the second Indian-language song ever (after the mostly Hindi "Jai Ho" from [i]Slumdog Millionaire[/i]), the first song from an Asian film, and the fourth non-English song ever to win the former.

Its music video, taken directly from the movie, involves protagonists Raju (Ram Charan) and Bheem (Rama Rao) singing and outdancing the rich British men attending a fancy British party.

Like all films made in India and their accompanying songs, both [i]RRR[/i] and "Naatu Naatu" have been given versions in several other major Indian languages including Hindi, Tamil, Kannada, and Malayalam.

h4. External links:
* "Wikipedia: Naatu Naatu":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Naatu_Naatu]
* "Full music video (Youtube)":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OsU0CGZoV8E]

title: kv-1
body:
The [b]Kliment Voroshilov Model One[/b], also known as the [b]KV-1[/b], is a [[Soviet Army]] heavy [[tank]] deployed at the beginning of [[World War II]], equipped with the same 76.2mm gun as the latter  [[T-34]] while being around ~15t heavier. 

Its armor was enough to survive the majority of [[Germany]]'s AT guns during the early part of the war at the Eastern Front. Gradually replaced in later years of the conflict (but continued to be used in some units unitl the end). A number of derivatives were also built on the hull, such as the [[KV-2]] (armed with a 152mm howitzer).

title: kv-2
body:
The [b]Kliment Voroshilov Model Two (KV-2)[/b] [[tank]] was an early [[World War II]] [[Soviet]] heavy tank that shared the same chassis with the earlier [[KV-1]] with the exception of a large turret housing the very powerful M10 howitzer. 

It saw limited action in the early stages of the war, one notable event being a lone KV-2 that pinned the lead elements of the German advance for a day.

This heavy tank was feared among the Germans for its very powerful armament combined with a very thick and resistant armor. It was known to be able to destroy even the heavier German tanks with a single salvo from its cannon, and could also withstand several shots from the enemies most powerful guns.

Its main flaws were low mobility and a very high profile due to its unusually tall and heavy turret, designed to house the howitzer. As well as slow reload time.

Due to its unique characteristics, the KV-2 has gained popularity among the tank enthusiastists, especially after its inclusion in various video games, such as [[World of Tanks]] and [[War Thunder]].

h4. See also

* [[List of Ground Vehicles]]
* [[Girls und Panzer]]
* [[World of Tanks]]
* [[War Thunder]]

title: single-shoulder_one-piece_swimsuit
body:
A [[one-piece swimsuit]] with an asymmetrical, diagonal-shaped neckline, leaving a portion of the upper chest area and at least one shoulder [[bare shoulders|bare]]. These bikinis are typically supported by a [[single sleeve]] or a [[single strap]] on one shoulder while the other is left bare. The neckline of the bikini starts on top of one shoulder and ends underneath the armpit between the torso and opposite arm.

Examples include post #6610244, post #6566675, post #4724691, post #4431904, post #6502897, post #5620191, post #6576862, post #6527111

Do [b]not[/b] confuse this tag for [[off-shoulder one-piece swimsuit]]s that expose one bare shoulder, or a regular one-piece swimsuit with its [[strap slip|strap(s) slipping off from the shoulders]].

h5."Visual chart":[https://files.catbox.moe/9dzd5o.png] demonstrating what outfits qualify as a "single-shoulder shirt/dress/sweater/bikini/etc."

title: miyamizu_mitsuha
body:
Female protagonist of the movie [[Kimi no Na wa.]] A 17-year old schoolgirl from the fictional country town of Itomori, somewhere in the mountains of Gifu Prefecture, Japan.

She has [[brown eyes]] and [[long_hair|long]] [[black hair]] that is usually tied into [[twin braids]] and folded up before being tied by a [[red_ribbon|red]] [[hair ribbon]]. At one point in the film, she has it cut [[short_hair|short]], but it later regrows, by which time she wears it in a [[half updo]] (or a [[french braid]]? It's not very clear). Her default [[school uniform]] has a white blouse with [[short sleeves]], a red bowtie, a black [[miniskirt]] and [[black socks|black]] [[kneehighs]]. She has also been depicted wearing a brown [[sweater vest]], a grey one paired with a [[long sleeves|long sleeved]] blouse, and a blue [[yukata]].

title: tohru_(maidragon)
body:
Tohru is a main character from [[Kobayashi-san chi no Maidragon]]. She is a [[dragon]] from a parallel world, who travels to modern-day Japan where she takes the form of a [[dragon girl]]. She lives with [[kobayashi_(maidragon)|Kobayashi]] and [[Kanna Kamui]], while working as Kobayashi's maid.

In her dragon girl form, she has [[long_hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] in [[twintails]] which [[gradient_hair|blends]] to [[orange_hair|orange]] towards the tips. She has [[orange eyes]] with [[slit pupils]]. Tohru always possess [[dragon horns]]. While at home she features a large green [[dragon tail]], but while out in society it is usually magically hidden. While in dragon girl form she very occasionally displays a pair of [[dragon wings]]. Tohru is most often depicted wearing a cosplay-style [[maid|maid uniform]] featuring a red [[ascot]], [[puffy short sleeves]], [[white_gloves|white]] [[elbow gloves]] and a [[maid headdress]].

For Tohru's dragon form, see [[Tohru (dragon) (maidragon)|]].

h4. External links

* "Kobayashi-san Chi no Maid Dragon Wiki: Tohru":[https://maid-dragon.fandom.com/wiki/Tohru]

title: benigno_aquino_jr
body:
[b]Benigno Simeon Aquino Jr.[/b], nicknamed "[b]Ninoy[/b]" (November 27, 1932 - August 21, 1983) was a Filipino politician serving as a Senator of the Philippines from 1967 to 1972, a longtime opposition of the dictator [[Ferdinand Marcos]].

He died on August 21, 1983 due to assassination. His death served as a catalyst for the People Power Revolution of February 1986 which led to Marcos' removal from power. The date of his assassination eventually became a commemorated holiday in the Philippines known as "Ninoy Aquino Day."

h4.External links

* "Wikipedia":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ninoy_Aquino]

title: monarch_(titanfall_2)
body:
A [[Titan (Titanfall)|]] class in [[Titanfall 2]]. The Monarch is a reverse engineered Titan class created by Vinson Dynamics and based on the SRS' original [[Vanguard (Titanfall 2)|Vanguard-class]] Titans (such as [[BT-7274]]). Unlike the Vanguards, Monarchs do not require a neural link, nor do they feature a semi-sentient AI system.

h1. Loadout
Primary Weapon: [[XO Chaingun|XO16A2 Chaingun]]
Ordnance: Rocket Salvo, Multi-Target Missile System
Tactical: Rearm
Defensive: Energy Siphon
Core: Upgrade Core
Other Equipment: Acolyte Pods

title: stryder_(titanfall)
body:
A lightweight [[Titan (Titanfall)|]] class in [[Titanfall]]. It was developed by Hammond Robotics as a speed-focused Titan ideal for hit-and-run thanks to it's high speed and light armor. It served as the developmental base for the [[Northstar (Titanfall)|Northstar-class]] and [[Ronin (Titanfall 2)|Ronin-class]] Titans.

The Stryder is equipped with a Dash Core, which allows it to dash nonstop while active.

title: ogre_(titanfall)
body:
A heavy [[Titan (Titanfall)|]] class in [[Titanfall]]. Developed by Hammond Robotics and Wonyeon Defensive, it is slower than it's contemporaries but features much heavier armor. It served as the developmental base for the [[Legion (Titanfall 2)|Legion-class]] and [[Scorch (Titanfall 2)|Scorch-class]] Titans.

The Ogre is equipped with a Shield Core, which amps its' shields while active.

title: atlas_(titanfall)
body:
A balanced [[Titan (Titanfall)|]] class in [[Titanfall]]. It was the first ever Titan produced by Hammond Robotics and served as the development base for the [[Ion (Titanfall 2)|Ion-class]] and [[Tone (Titanfall 2)|Tone-class]] Titans.

The Atlas is equipped with a Damage Core, which allows it to deal extra damage while active.

title: fs-1041
body:
A [[Vanguard (Titanfall 2)|Vanguard-class]] [[Titan (Titanfall)|]] that appears in [[Titanfall 2]]. It first appears during the training sequence at the beginning of the game, and is later dropped in for [[Jack Cooper]] after the destruction of [[BT-7274]]'s original chassis. The current state of FS' original AI is unknown, as the chassis was dropped without an AI core so that Jack could place BT's inside of it.

The FS chassis is distinguishable from BT's original chassis by it's dark grey coloration.

title: bakugou_katsuki
body:
Deuteragonist of [[Boku no Hero Academia]], and [[Midoriya Izuku]]'s rival since childhood. His Quirk allows him to produce explosions from the sweat on his hands. Bakugou is very aggressive and short-tempered, often yelling at others or threatening to kill them. He has a superiority complex and hates being looked down on.

Bakugou has [[spiked hair|spiked]] [[blonde hair]] and [[red eyes]]. He is the only student in Class 1A who does not wear a tie with his [[school uniform]].

title: commando_(movie)
body:
A 1985 action film, directed by Mark L. Lester and starring [[Arnold Schwarzenegger]] and Rae Dawn Chong.

Notable for its special effects failures, quotable one-liners, blatant continuity errors and hilarious amounts of violence. The movie has become a meme both in America and in Japan (due to its campy dub on [[TV Asahi]]), spawning YTPMVs, MADs, and of course ASCII art.

title: world_sportscar_championship
body:
A now-defunct motorsport series sanctioned by the [[federation internationale de l'automobile|FIA]] that ran from 1953 to 1992. The series was based around endurance racing, primarily featuring [[le mans prototype|prototype-class]] (including the iconic Group C) and GT [[sports car]]s as the [[racecar]]s. The WSC featured a number of iconic endurance races during it's run with most years including the [[circuit de la sarthe|24 Hours of Le Mans]], the [[daytona international speedway|24 Hours at Daytona]], and the [[sebring international raceway|12 Hours of Sebring]].

The [[World Endurance Championship]] was founded in 2012 as a modern revival of the WSC.
other_names: スポーツカー世界選手権

title: kitchen_range
body: A kitchen range is a large [[kitchen]] appliance that combines a [[stove|stovetop]] with an [[oven]].  Due to their large size they're not as common in Japan as they are in the United States, both due to size constraints and common cuisine that does not need an oven for cooking or baking.

title: fish_grill
body:
A fish grill or fish broiler is a kitchen appliance used primarily for the purpose of cooking fish and is commonly integrated into Japanese kitchen [[stove]] tops.  It generally appears as a small windowed drawer around the control knobs of the stove top below the burners.  It's used by pulling it open like a drawer where one can then place fish or other items to cook onto a grill, and then slide them back inside where they'll be placed under a broiler-like burner.  The knob to control the fish grill is typically located with the knobs for the stove top.

Example of a fish grill in operation: post #2745382, post #5005518

title: bike_rake_barricade
body: A portable metal or plastic [[fence]] used for crowd control.  Named after the [[bicycle rack|bike rake]] for which they're visually similar to.

title: traffic_barrel
body:
A traffic barrel is a plastic barrel-shaped object usually orange or yellow in color with reflective markings that is used as a [[traffic barrier]] to channel traffic away or around obstacles and construction sites. Essentially a larger version of the [[traffic cone]].  For night work, there may be small flashing lights attached to the top of the barrels.  They're typically filled with either water or sand.  They're also called: [i]traffic drum, construction barrel[/i], and [i]construction drum[/i].

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Construction barrel":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Construction_barrel]

title: shashka
body:
The [b]shashka[/b] is a kind of [[saber (weapon)|sabre]]; a single-edged, single-handed, and guardless [[weapon|backsword]]. The comparatively subtle curve of a shashka blade puts the weapon midway between a typically curved sabre and a straight [[sword]]. Its pommel generally protrudes to the side, causing a hooked hilt shape.
[tn](post #2763050 for example)[/tn]

It is often wielded by Russian or Ukrainian [[cossack]]s.

h1. See also
* [[List of Weapons]]
* [[Slavic clothes]]

title: kotaku
body:
An American gaming news website and blog owned by G/O Media.

They were a key target in the Gamergate controversy and several gaming companies have blacklisted their website over posting articles on leaks and insider information on upcoming games.  They have also had some in-depth articles revealing major issues within game developers, such as one of the earliest reporting of the major developmental issues that lead up to the release of [[Bioware]]'s game [[Anthem (game)|]].

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Kotaku":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kotaku]

title: kurumi_(lycoris_recoil)
body:
A character in [[Lycoris Recoil]].

A master hacker who goes by the codename "Walnut". Her real name is unknown, as she simply gives her name as "Kurumi" (which is the Japanese word for walnut) as an alias.

She has [[blue eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] with a noticeably large [[forehead]]. She usually wears a [[black ribbon|black]] [[hair ribbon]] [[bow hairband]] and a [[white hoodie]] with a [[yellow hood]] and a [[squirrel print]].

Her cafe attire, where she works as a [[waitress]], consists of a [[yellow kimono]] and an [[apron]].

She is voiced by [[Kuno Misaki]].

h4. See Also

* "Lycoris Recoil Wiki: Kurumi":https://lycoris-recoil.fandom.com/wiki/Kurumi
other_names: クルミ(リコリスリコイル)
クルミ(リコリス・リコイル)

title: deep_frying
body:
A method of [[cooking]] where food is submerged in hot [[cooking oil]].  Traditionally done using a pan full of oil over heat, though today dedicated standalone devices called a [[deep fryer]] are most commonly used commercially.

Due to the combination of large quantities of hot oil and open flame, deep frying can be fairly hazardous either through the oil causing scalding or causing hard to control fires.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Deep frying":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Deep_frying]

title: deep_fryer
body:
A deep fryer, or deep fat fryer, is a kitchen appliance used for deep frying. They're an appliance which can hold and heat [[cooking oil]] in which to put food into for cooking. Most deep fryers feature a [[deep fry basket|metal basket]] in which to lower food into the fryer and retrieve it when done cooking.

[[Deep frying]] is a method of cooking in which food is fully submerged into oil at high heat. Dedicated deep fryers are generally preferred over deep frying using a pot and stove, as deep fryers are better able to regulate oil temperatures.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Deep fryer":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Deep_fryer]

title: kalki_(housamo)
body:
[[Tokyo Afterschool Summoners]] character.
Designed by [[Amamiya (ammami8)|]]

This Transient has a highly sculpted physique, four strong arms, a stubborn will, and a scrupulous mind that leads him to detest chaos of any kind. He was seen as destruction incarnate in the world he hailed from. After being summoned to Tokyo, he was angered by the chaos and considered destroying everything but then the arrow of Cupid struck his heart, causing him to fall in love. He is extremely stand-off-ish in nature, but sweet as sugar when facing with the one he loves. He would still take the opportunity to destroy the world at the drop of a hat, so he needs to be watched closely.

h4. External Links

* "Housamo Wiki: Kalki":[https://housamo.wiki/Kalki]

title: tohno_motosumi
body:
[[Tokyo Afterschool Summoners]] character.
Designed by [[Amamiya (ammami8)|]]

Full name is Motosumi Tohno. A stereotypical high school delinquent who hangs around Asakusa in Taito Ward. Due to certain events, he ended up adopting two oni infants, [[zenki_(housamo)|Zenki]] and [[gouki (housamo)|Goki]], as their papa rather than their Summoner. Ever since he was small, he'd get into fights after staring people down, but he's also sentimental, easily moved to tears, and has a caring heart of gold when it comes to kids. He dyed his hair blond, thinking that looking strong would prevent others from picking fights with him, but this ironically led to more frequent conflict.

h4. External Links

* "Housamo Wiki: Motosumi":[https://housamo.wiki/Motosumi]

title: mikakunin_de_shinkoukei
body:
Known in English as "Engaged to the Unidentified".  A 4koma series by [[Arai Cherry]] which received a 12-episode anime adaptation.

[[yonomori kobeni|Kobeni Yonomori]] is a high school girl who lives with [[yonomori_akane|her mother]] and older sister [[yonomori_benio|Benio]]. Upon turning sixteen, Kobeni is shocked to learn that, due to an arrangement by her late grandfather, she is engaged to a boy named [[mitsumine hakuya|Hakuya Mitsumine]] who, along with his little sister [[mitsumine mashiro|Mashiro]], come to live with Kobeni. As Kobeni spends time adjusting to this new family, she learns there is more to Hakuya and Mashiro than meets the eye.

title: knight_rider_(2008)
body:
[b][i]Knight Rider[/i][/b] (2008 TV Series) is an American action television show that follows the 1982 television series in the same title created by Glen A. Larson and the 2008 television movie. The series was originally broadcast on NBC from September 24, 2008 to March 4, 2009.


The show stars Justin Bruening as Michael Traceur, the estranged son of Michael Knight; with a high-tech modern crime fighter assisted by K.I.T.T (Knight Industries Three Thousand). An advanced artificially intelligent, self-aware and nearly indestructible Ford Mustang Shelby GT500KR.

title: gakkou_no_kaidan_(tv_series)
body:
Gakkō no Kaidan (学校のカイダン, lit. The School's Ladder) is a 2015 Japanese tv drama series.

Haruna Tsubame, an inconspicuous high school girl, is always sensitive to people’s moods and keeps the peace in school. One day, she gets pushed to become the president of the student council by the people around her. Tsubame’s encounter with a man who is a genius speechwriter, leads to a revolution in school. She struggles to change a school full of irrationality and dissatisfaction with the power of words.

h4. See Also

title: miyaura_sanshio
body:

The artist has also called her 宮雯汐, which is Gung Manzik in Cantonese. The artist has also called her 宮汐, which is Gongxi in Mandarin.

She has [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] usually [[hair between eyes|between]] her [[purple eyes]] and often with an [[ahoge]]. She has [[large breasts]].
She is often dressed as an [[office lady]] with a [[pencil skirt]], [[black pantyhose]], and [[dress shirt]].

宮浦家の長女です
弟は宮浦大和です 妹は宮浦希子です

スペアリブの甘酢がけが好きでいつも食べている。

title: tortoiseshell-framed_eyewear
body:
[[glasses|Eyewear]] which its frames has pattern that replicates the look and pattern of a tortoise [[shell]]. Such style of [[sunglasses|eyewear]] were first popularized in the 1920s and the frames were made of real turtles and large tortoises. The practice was quickly banned worldwide in 1973.

Today, the frames of tortoiseshell-frame eyewear are made of polymer, such as stained acetates.

title: luigi_torelli_(kancolle)
body:
Italian submarine Luigi Torelli, the fourth Marconi-class submarine, as depicted in [[Kantai Collection]], named after Italian scientific fellow and patriot "Luigi Torelli (9 February 1810 – 14 November 1887)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Luigi_Torelli].

In-game, because of having a male name (and also sharing a name with [[Luigi|a certain plumber]]), she calls herself "Lu."

She is depicted as a [[flat_chest|flat-chested girl]] with [[medium hair|shoulder-length]] [[blonde hair]] with [[green eyes]] wearing initially a white [[hairband]] and black [[thighhighs|thigh-high boots]]. She wears a grey thigh-length [[sleeveless]] and skirted [[wetsuit]] with green accents. Her garb changes with each remodel: As [[uit-25 (kancolle)|U.IT.25]] (or "Ui"), she gains [[arm warmers]], red, white, and black shoulder pads, and a black hairband. Then, upon becoming [[i-504 (kancolle)|I-504]] (or "Go"), she reverts to her white hairband, but is otherwise reduced to nothing else but a [[white school swimsuit|white]] [[school swimsuit]]. Despite the changes in wardrobe, her standard submarine [[machinery]], with its grey and green livery, mostly stays the same.

Luigi Torelli has the unique distinction in the game as the shipgirl to serve all three Axis powers, representing one of the two ships that ever did so (the other being another Italian submarine [[Comandante Cappellini (kancolle)|]]). The historical submarine originally patrolled the Mediterranean Sea, sinking and damaging Greek and British commercial ships before surviving an attack by Vickers Wellington bombers using Leigh light on June 3, 1942. Due to her dimensions, she was deemed fit for long travels and thus was among seven submarines sent to the Far East in 1943, retaining her Italian crew despite being under Kriegsmarine command. After the new Italian government signed an armistice with the Allies the same year, the historal [i]Luigi Torelli[/i] was passed to full German command under the name [i]U.IT.25[/i] and took part in German war operations in the Pacific. After Germany's surrender in 1945, ex-[i]Luigi Torelli[/i]'s IJN custodians then took over control, renaming her [i]I-504[/i]. She was under the Japanese flag when she shot down a B-25 Mitchell bomber near the very end of the World War II in the Pacific, allegedly the last Axis naval success. She was captured by American forces in Kobe at the conclusion of the war and eventually scuttled by the US Navy in the Kii Channel on April 16, 1946.

h4. See also:
* [[uit-25 (kancolle)|U.IT.25 (Kantai Collection)]] 
* [[I-504 (kancolle)|]]
* "Luigi Torelli on Kancolle Wikia":[http://kancolle.wikia.com/wiki/Luigi_Torelli]
* "Wikipedia article on the historical Luigi Torelli":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Italian_submarine_Luigi_Torelli]

title: red_guard
body:
A [[China|Chinese]] [[Communism|Communist]] volunteer paramilitary organization founded during the era of [[Mao Zedong]] in China. Their attire consists of a [[mao cap]], green simplified [[military uniform]] with a red collar, a [[red armband]], a [[red scarf]], and often holding [[quotations_from_chairman_mao_zedong|"the red book"]] containing various quotes from Mao Zedong himself.

Prevalent during the [[Cultural Revolution]] period of China, as they were usually involved in enforcing the "standardization" of Chinese culture.

She has [[brown eyes]], [[medium breasts]], and [[medium hair|medium length]] [[brown hair]] stylized in [[low twintails]] with [[blunt bangs]]. She usually wears the [[Shuuchiin Academy School Uniform]] with [[black pantyhose|black]] [[pantyhose]].



h4. See Also

* https://kaguyasama-wa-kokurasetai.fandom.com/wiki/Miko_Iino

title: kagawa_rin
body:
A character in [[Soredemo Ayumu wa Yosetekuru]]. A junior to [[Tanaka Ayumu]], [[Yaotome Urushi]], and [[Mikage Sakurako]].

She has [[black eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]] [[bangs]]. Her [[serafuku]] [[school uniform]] consists of a [[white shirt|white]] [[shirt]], [[black sailor collar|black]] [[sailor collar]], [[red neckerchief|red]] [[neckerchief]] and a [[black skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[skirt]], and she wears it with [[bike shorts under skirt|bike shorts under her skirt]] and [[black socks|black]] [[kneehighs]].

h4. See Also
* "Soredemo Ayumu wa Yosetekuru Wiki: Kagawa Rin":https://soredemo-ayumu.fandom.com/wiki/Kagawa_Rin

title: jimeko-san
body:
A supporting character of [i][[Gugure! Kokkuri-san]][/i].

She is a classmate of [[Ichimatsu Kohina]], and a tsundere with a complicated relationship with Kohina.  

She has [[blue eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[orange hair]] with [[short twintails]] tied by [[hair bobbles]], as well as [[hair intakes]]. She is most frequently seen wearing a [[school uniform]] and wears [[black socks|black]] [[kneehighs]].

title: sol_emerald
body:
A set of seven gemstones in the [[sonic_(series)|Sonic the Hedgehog]] series. They exist in the Sol Dimension, a parallel dimension to [[sonic_the_hedgehog|Sonic]]'s, and are a counterpart of the [[chaos_emerald|Chaos Emeralds]].
The Sol Emeralds are guarded by [[Blaze the Cat]], who can transform into [[Burning Blaze]] when using all seven of them.

title: onda_yukari_(samidare)
body:
Onda Yukari is a character from [[Lost Property Control Organization (samidare)|]] a series created by [[Samidare (Hoshi)]]. She is a student at the school the [[Protagonist (lost property control organization)|]] is attending, and also works at a specialty store.

She has somewhat [[messy hair|messy]], [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[black hair]] and wears a pair of purple-rimmed [[glasses]].

title: clammy_zell
body:
クラミー・ツェル（[i]Chlammy Zell[/i]）

A character in [[No Game No Life]].

An 18-year-old [i]Imanity[/i] and a close friend to [[Feel Nilvalen]]. She allies herself with the [i]Elves[/i] in order to win the king's contest, believing that Imanity, as it is, has no chance of getting anywhere on their own.

Chlammy has [[pink_eyes|pink]]/[[purple_eyes|purple]] eyes, [[long_hair|long]], dark [[purple hair]] with [[side_ponytail|side-ponytailed]] [[hair rings]]. She covers part of her face with [[veil]]. She also wears [[black thighhighs|thigh]][[zettai_ryouiki|highs]] and [[bridal gauntlets]] that reach [[elbow_gloves|beyond her elbow]].

h4.See also:
* Wikia (EN): http://no-game-no-life.wikia.com/wiki/Chlammy_Zell
* MyAnimeList (EN): http://myanimelist.net/character/97763/Chlammy_Zell
* Official character desc. (JP): http://ngnl.jp/images/img-character-chlammy.png

title: holy_maiden_academy_school_uniform
body:
A [[school uniform]] in [[Magia Record: Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica Gaiden]], worn by the [[mahou shoujo tart magica|Tart Magica]] cast.

It has two color variants, depending on the student's status (white-and-blue for regular students, black-and-red for the student council), and it seems to have gendered variants.

The school council's feminine variant consists of a [[black jacket|black]] [[blazer]] with [[notched lapels|notched]] [[lapels]], [[pocket]]s, [[buttons]], [[red trim|red edges]] and the [[school emblem]] - a [[griffin]]; a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], a [[red ribbon|red]] [[neck ribbon]]; a [[pleated skirt|pleated]], [[plaid skirt|plaid]], [[red skirt|red]]-and-[[black skirt|black]] [[miniskirt]] and [[black footwear|black]] [[loafers]]. All members also wear [[armband]]s and [[black pantyhose|black]] [[pantyhose]].

The school council's masculine variant consists of a [[black jacket|black]] [[blazer]] with [[notched lapels|notched]] [[lapels]], [[pocket]]s, [[buttons]], [[red trim|red edges]] and the [[school emblem]] - a [[griffin]]; a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], a [[red ribbon|red]] [[neck ribbon]], [[black pants|black]] [[pants]] and [[black footwear|black]] [[loafers]]. It is worn with an [[armband]]. 

The regular students' feminine variant consists of a [[white jacket|white]] [[blazer]] with [[notched lapels|notched]] [[lapels]], [[pocket]]s, [[buttons]] and the [[school emblem]] - [[fleur-de-lis]] (the symbol can also be seen on the jacket's bottom), a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], a [[black ribbon|black]] [[neck ribbon]]; a [[pleated skirt|pleated]], [[plaid skirt|plaid]], [[blue skirt|blue]] [[miniskirt]] and [[black footwear|black]] [[loafers]].

There is no canon masculine variant of the regular students' uniform.

h4. Notable students
h5. Student Council
* [[Corbeau (madoka magica)|]] (masculine variant)
* [[Lapin (madoka magica)|]] (feminine variant)
* [[Minou (madoka magica)|]] (feminine variant)
h5. Regular students
* [[Elisa Celjska]] (accessorizes with a [[yellow necktie|yellow]] [[necktie]], [[red sweater|red]] [[sweater]] with a [[v-neck]] and [[brown pantyhose|brown]] [[pantyhose]]; has the [[open jacket|jacket]] and [[open collar|collar]] open; switches the typical black loafers for [[brown footwear|brown]] ones)
* [[Jeanne d'Arc (madoka magica)|]] (accessorizes with [[white pantyhose|white]] [[pantyhose]])
* [[Melissa de Vignolles]] (accessorizes with a [[shoulder bag]] and [[grey socks|grey]] [[kneehighs]])
* [[Riz Hawkwood]] (accessorizes with [[black pantyhose]], has the [[open jacket|jacket]] and [[open collar|collar]] open in a way that exposes [[cleavage]])

title: thong_bikini
body:
A [[bikini]] with a [[thong]] bottom. A thong bottom is a thin strip between the buttocks that leaves most of the butt cheeks bare.

Don't use this tag unless you can tell the bikini bottom leaves the butt cheeks bare. Most thong bikinis are also [[string bikini]]s, but not all string bikinis are thong bikinis.

Most [[micro bikini]]s are also thong bikinis due to their skimpiness.

h4. See also

* [[g-string]]

A [[school uniform]] in [[Magia Record: Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica Gaiden]].

It consists of a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt|collared]] [[shirt]], a [[blue necktie|blue]] [[diagonal-striped necktie|diagonal-striped]] [[necktie]], a [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[blue skirt|blue]]/[[black skirt|black]] [[plaid skirt|plaid]] [[miniskirt]] and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[loafers]].

h4. Notable students
* [[Yume Urara]] (pairs it with a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[green hoodie|green]][[multicolored hoodie|-and-]][[white hoodie|white]] [[hood down|hood]][[hoodie|ie]] with [[pocket]]s and [[drawstring]]s, and [[white socks|white]] [[ankle socks]] with [[double horizontal stripe]]s; additionally wears the shirt with an [[open collar]], and [[loose necktie|loosens]] the tie)

title: bender_bending_rodriguez
body: Bender Bending Rodríguez (designated in-universe as Bending Unit 22, unit number 1,729, serial number 2716057) is one of the main characters in the animated television series [[Futurama]]. He was conceived by the series' creators Matt Groening and David X. Cohen, and is voiced by John DiMaggio. He fulfills a comic, antihero-type role in Futurama and is described by fellow character [[Turanga Leela| Leela]] as an "alcoholic, whore-mongering, chain-smoking gambler".

title: zhongli_(genshin_impact)
body:
[[Genshin Impact]] character.

Wangsheng Funeral Parlor's mysterious consultant. Handsome, elegant, and surpassingly learned. Though no one knows where Zhongli is from, he is a master of courtesy and rules. From his seat at Wangsheng Funeral Parlor, he performs all manner of rituals.

[spoiler]His true identity is [[Rex Lapis (Genshin Impact)|]], The Geo Archon.[/spoiler]

As a result of certain in-game lore, he is sometimes drawn in a [[genderswap_(mtf)|female form]].

His name is pronounced [b]Shouri[/b] in the Japanese version of the game.

title: owen_gun
body:
The [b]Owen gun[/b], or Owen machine carbine, was an Australian [b][[submachine gun]][/b] designed by Evelyn Owen in 1938. It was used during the World War II (from 1942) by the Australian Army until 1971.
The [[gun]] is recognizable by its top-mounted magazine, [[vertical foregrip]] and the side-mounted sight required to allow the shooter to aim past it. Available in both wooden or triangular skeletonized metal stock.

h1. See also
* [[F1 submachine gun]]
* [[List of Weapons]]
* [[Owen (Girls' Frontline)]]

title: hammock
body: A hammock (from Spanish hamaca, borrowed from the Taíno and Arawak word "hamaka") is a sling made of fabric, rope, or netting, suspended between two or more points, used for swinging, sleeping, or resting. It normally consists of one or more cloth panels, or a woven network of twine or thin rope stretched with ropes between two firm anchor points such as trees or posts.

title: valley
body:
An area of low-lying land between [[hill]]s or [[mountain]]s. Most valleys are formed by water erosion over an extremely long period of time, and often contain [[river]]s. 

h4. See also
* [[canyon]]
* [[ravine]]
* [[chasm]]

title: canyon
body:
A deep depression between cliffs carved from the landscape by a river. Often formed by a process of long-time erosion from a plateau level, and are very wide and meandering. Not to be confused with [[ravine]], which is both more narrow and straight.

h4. See also 
* [[ravine]]
* [[chasm]]

body: Xamaran is an NPC in The Chasm: Underground Mines region of [[Genshin Impact]]. It is a talking [[giant mushroom]] creature hailing from Sumeru.

title: chasm
body: A very deep and narrow trench between two [[cliff]]s. May extend deep into the subterranean.

title: ravine
body:
A steep, rocky area notably lower in elevation than its surroundings, often the effect of streambank erosion. May feature a [[river]] and/or rocky walls. Not to be confused with [[canyon]], which is wider and meanders due to its river formation.

h4. See also
* [[canyon]]
* [[chasm]]

title: tokyo_afterschool_summoners
body:
LGBT mobile RPG by Lifewonders, also known as Housamo by fans. Focuses on a group of high school students (the titular "Summoners") using fantastic beings (transients) to fight. Both humans and transients utilize mysterious artifacts to fight in duels; duelists organize into guilds, which fight for control of the 23 special wards of Tokyo.

h4. See Also

body:
A box used by house-trained [[cat]]s to defecate. Simulates the dirt/sand they would use in the wild. Owners must change its litter a few times a week to keep it clean. 

In addition to cats and other small animals, one might also find characters [[peeing]] into litter boxes.

title: f1_submachine_gun
body:
The [b]F1[/b] is a 9mm Australian [b][[submachine gun]][/b] manufactured by the Lithgow Small Arms Factory. First issued to Australian troops in July 1963, it replaced the [[Owen gun]]. The [[weapon]] resembles a hybrid between the [[Owen gun]] and [[sterling smg|Sterling submachine gun]] due to its tubular barrel shroud with circular perforations and top-mounted magazine.

h1. See also
* [[F1 (Girls' Frontline)]]
* [[List of Weapons]]

title: hr-d3
body:
A giant [[mecha]] modeled after [[King Dedede]]. Originally set to appear in the now-cancelled [[Gamecube]] [i][[kirby_(series)|Kirby]][/i] game, it made its official debut as a boss in the [i]Kirby Quest[/i] subgame in [i][[Kirby Mass Attack]][/i]. It much-more-prominently appears in [i][[Kirby's Return to Dream Land]][/i] as an exclusive boss in Extra Mode right after defeating Metal General EX, as well as in The True Arena.

[spoilers]Any connections it or [[hr-h|HR-H]] may have to the Haltmann Works Company are for now left ambiguous.[/spoilers]

title: baskin-robbins
body:
A large chain of [[ice cream]] parlors based in Massachusetts, USA. Founded in California in 1945, by brothers-in-law Burt Baskin and Irv Robbins, the chain is international with stores in nearly 50 countries across the globe, including Japan. Its popular slogan "31 flavors" was coined in 1953 with the implication that a customer could have a different flavor for each day of the month. Thus, in Japan, Taiwan, and China, it is more popularly known as "Thirty-One Ice Cream".

The inner lines of the "BR" logo form a "31" shape. To avoid litigation, artists sometimes use other numbers, such as "13", which forms a "B".

h4. See also

* [[Cold Stone Creamery]]


h4. External links

* "Official website (US)":[http://www.baskinrobbins.com]
* "Official website (JP)":[https://www.31ice.co.jp/]
* "Wikipedia":[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Baskin-Robbins]
* "Logo reference":[https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Baskin-Robbins_logo.svg]: This version of the logo is still used in Japan.
other_names: サーティワンアイスクリーム

title: operation_market_garden
body:
[b]Operation Market Garden[/b] was an Allied [[military]] operation conceived and commanded by [[Bernard Montgomery]] during [[World War II]] in the German-occupied [[Netherlands]] from 17 to 27 September 1944. 

Its objective was to create a 64 mi (103 km) salient into German territory with a bridgehead over the River Rhine, creating an Allied invasion route into northern [[Germany]]. This was to be achieved by two sub-operations: seizing nine bridges with combined [[united_states|U.S.]] and [[united_kingdom|British]] airborne forces ([i]Market[/i]) followed by land forces swiftly following over the bridges ([i]Garden[/i]).

The airborne operation was planned and undertaken by the First Allied Airborne Army with the land operation by XXX Corps of the British Second Army. It was the largest airborne operation of the war up to that point.

Although the operation succeeded in liberating the Dutch cities of Eindhoven and Nijmegen along with many towns, and limited V-2 rocket launching sites, it failed to secure a bridgehead over the Rhine, with the advance being halted at the river.

h4. See also
* [[Battle of Arnhem]]
* [[Battle of Nijmegen]]
other_names: マーケット・ガーデン作戦

h4. Examples

title: cosmo_zero
body:
A fictional [[starfighter]] from the [[Uchuu Senkan Yamato]] [[science fiction]] TV anime series and the [[Uchuu Senkan Yamato 2199]] remake.

The [i]Earth Defense Force[/i] [b]Cosmo Zero[/b] is a type of very fast and agile interceptor [[spacecraft]] used mostly for long range armed reconnaissance and combat missions. 

It is much more faster than the [[black_tiger_(yamato)|Black Tiger]] and the [[Cosmo Falcon]], and also has a more potent and advanced sensor array and radar package in its nose, but is light armored and has less weaponry. 

The name of the starfighter is a tribute to the legendary [[A6M Zero]] fighter [[aircraft]] from [[World War II|World War II]].

title: chuunibyou_demo_koi_ga_shitai!
body:
Chuunibyou Demo Koi ga Shitai, officially translated as [i]Love, Chunibyo and Other Delusions![/i] is a light novel series by Torako, with illustration by [[Ousaka Nozomi]]. The first volume was published in May 2011 by [[Kyoto Animation]]'s KA Esuma Bunko. The novel was one of the honorable mention recipients in the Novel category of the first [[Kyoto Animation]] Award program in 2010.

When [[Togashi Yuuta]] graduated from middle school, he was finally cured from his "[[chuunibyou]]", and determined to forget his dark history and enjoy his high school life to the fullest. But then, he met [[Takanashi Rikka]] who still has the syndrome and forced to make a contract with her...

title: paradox_live
body:
Paradox Live (パラライ) is a Hip-Hop mix media project collaboration by AVEX × GCrest that debuted on February 2, 2020.
Set in the near future, a new music movement “Phantom Live” gains massive popularity among young people. Four music groups– BAE, The Cat’s Whiskers, cozmez and Akanyatsura (悪漢奴等)– have battled against one another in the mysterious music festival known as "Paradox Live".

After a disaster that caused the collapse of Club Paradox and prevented the final battle between the winning group and the legendary duo Buraikan, the club has been rebuilt with a brand new competition to take place. Four new groups– VISTY, AMPRULE, 1Nm8, and Goku Luck (獄Luck)– have joined the ring alongside the current cast. With different music styles, the music groups try to fight to the top.

title: phantometal_(paradox_live)
body:
In [[Paradox Live]], a Phantometal is a substance found within the accessories used by hip-hop and rap artists in the near future, and may also refer to the accessories themselves. It is a type of chemically reactive metal that when combined with the user's DNA, allows them to generate brilliant illusions in the environment that are linked to their emotions. 

It comes in a large variety of forms.

body:

Unlike her younger counterpart, [[kurona_(adult)|adult Kurona]] is magically extremely powerful, able to merge entire dimensions together. Appearance wise, adult Kurona retains many similar features to her younger counterpart, being a [[demon_girl|demon girl]] with a typical [[demon_tail|demon tail]], [[demon_horns|demon horns]] and Kurona's classic [[pink_hair|pink-ish hair]]. Unlike her younger version, she sports much larger [[demon_wings|demon wings]] and is typically seen wielding a large [[spear]] instead of an [[trident]] for combat.

title: tracen_academy
body:
The sports school that the [[Umamusume]] [[horse girl|horsegirl]]s study and train in. Formally known as the "Japan Umamusume Training Schools and Colleges", or "Tracen Academy" ([b]Tra[/b]ining [b]Cen[/b]tre) for short.

The main school building is shaped like a long E (or barred [s]I[/s]) with a prominent [[bell tower]] at its center. There is a courtyard immediately to its front encircled by a horseshoe-shaped covered walkway, with a fountain in the middle. Various other ancillary facilities can also be found within the academy grounds, including a horse racetrack on the fields behind the main building.

This tag is intended for the main "central" branch of Tracen Academy, though other branches of the school may be tentatively tagged as well for now should they appear.

Avoid using this tag for interior scenes as they might resemble those of an ordinary school.

title: howto:translate
body:
Translating on Danbooru is one major way to contribute, since "many images":[/posts?tags=translation_request] need translating. Danbooru utilizes a unique soft-translation system that enables translations to appear on images which are written in their native, non-English languages.


h4. Things to keep in mind before you start translating

* Be reasonably sure you understand the source material completely before attempting a translation. It is best to read through the material once before you begin to judge its difficulty; if it seems too high in places, it's best to leave it for another.
* Please leave honorifics in place. This is to keep a consistent style of honorific usage across the board, and Japanese honorifics usually don't translate well to English titles.
* Try not to introduce elements which were not present in the original. Given that Japanese leans on implication and context, sometimes it is unavoidable to make matters explicit in English.
* Don't use Japanese words if an equivalent English term exists.
** But don't go overboard with the above. Some Japanese concepts are untranslatable. If you have to choose between accuracy, understanding, and English, it's better to sacrifice English than understanding or accuracy.
* Make sure your English is idiomatic and well-written. Wooden translations mimicking the Japanese word-for-word are not proper translations. Try to select idioms with the same meanings as Japanese counterparts.
** Limit translation notes to the most intractable jokes, puns, and cultural concepts. It is better for the reader to miss a shade of meaning than be forced to halt and read a note.
** Puns and jokes are a special category on their own. Here it's allowable to be much more flexible, as long as the general meaning remains. It's heaps better to make a joke that clicks in English and then explain nuances in a translation note, than to make something completely unfunny and then explain in a note why it was a joke.
* Endeavor to completely translate the material on an image. That said, if you encounter something you don't understand, it is better to leave it partially translated and put out a call for help.
** When making partial translations, or when continuing on after leaving something untranslated, be reasonably sure the missing context isn't overly detrimental to your understanding.
* Use the names romanized in the same way as our tags have them. Generally this means Surname Forename, and make sure you stick to [[howto:romanize|our romanization rules]] too.
* [b]Ask for help.[/b] Everyone makes mistakes, including native speakers at times. The Japanese language is full of nuances that are sometimes hard to capture in plain text. That being said, try not to translate something out of your understanding -- it is better to have a decent translation improved, than to have a nonsensical translation figured out.

[expand=Translation tasks by difficulty/complexity:]

1. Single words and common phrases
2. Phrases and simple sentence
3. Complex sentences and simple single page comics
4. Simple multipage comics
5. Complex single page comics and paragraphs of text ([[text_focus]] or commentary translation)
6. Complex multipage comics

As a rule of thumb, start small and work your way up. If something feels too difficult or comes out clunky, move to easier tasks until you get the hang of translating
[/expand]

h4. Step by step breakdown of how to translate

* Go to an image in need of translation (look at [[translation_request]]s). You can also try searching the comments for people who "bumped images for translation":[/comments?commit=Search&group_by=comment&search%5Bbody_matches%5D=translation&search%5Border%5D=id_desc&utf8=%E2%9C%93].
* Click on Add Translation in the sidebar to the left or press 'n' on the keyboard. Click and drag on the image around where the text is. One note will be created. (Use multiple notes for multiple parts!)
* To change the size of a note after creating it, move (by dragging) and resize (by dragging the bottom right corner) the note. [b]Remember to save afterwards.[/b] Your changes won't do anything until you save, so it's better to move, then add text than the other way around.
* [b]Try to make the notes as small as possible.[/b] They should obscure the minimal area of the picture. If there are natural borders (such as a rectangular speech box) you can use to hide the note, do it. Make the note match the box pixel-for-pixel as best as you can. Alternatively, stick it as close to the text as possible. (The first frame of post #4487 is a good example of fitting a translation box to text, and post #577456 of fitting it to a box in the image.)
* Hover the mouse cursor inside the note to make an empty square appear below it. Click it to edit.
* Write your translation in the box. Limited HTML markup is allowed; a list of useful tags is available at [[about:note_formatting]]. The site provides several custom named fonts for translation use that are not dependent on browser or OS: see [[about:note_fonts]] for a list. Use <tn>translation note here</tn> to add a translation note. Don't add a linebreak before a translation note, that's done automatically.
* Repeat until all the text has been translated.
* [b]Make sure you change the [[translation_request]] tag to [[translated]]![/b] 

h4. Tags relating to translation

* [[translation_request]] - images with significant Japanese (or other language, combine with for example [[chinese_text]]) text to translate, that's left completely or partially untranslated.
* [[partially_translated]] - images that have been partially translated. As mentioned above, this isn't generally encouraged, but in some cases it can be fine, such as when the image is very long, or when the text is not strongly related (for example post #570410).
* [[check_translation]] - used for images that have been translated but that either the translator or other people are unsure about whether it's right. Or, perhaps the English is so confusing that the translation needs double-checking to convert it to something that makes sense.
* [[translated]] - images that have been [i]completely[/i] translated. Nothing less than completely (and properly) translated, please. When placing this tag, Remove the [[translation_request]] tag and the [[partially_translated]] if it's there. An image should never be tagged with [[translated]] and [[translation_request]].
* [[hard-translated]] - images that have already gone through [[third-party_edit]] to replace the original text (Japanese or otherwise) with a translation into another different language. It is discouraged on Danbooru.

h4. Translation aids for Danbooru

* "Note assist":[/forum_topics/9373] is a userscript that adds new features to the note system. They include automatically resizing your notes to fit the text as well as buttons for quick access to more advanced note formatting such as text size and color. It is still a work-in-progress and aimed at advanced users.

h4. See also

* [[List of SFX]]

h4. External resources

* Google: Multiple translation options
** https://translate.google.com
** [b]Note:[/b] Straight-up machine translations are not allowed
* WWWJDIC: Japanese -> English
** http://nihongo.monash.edu/cgi-bin/wwwjdic
** http://www.edrdg.org/cgi-bin/wwwjdic/wwwjdic
* DeepL: Japanese -> English
** https://www.deepl.com/translator
** [b]Note:[/b] Straight-up machine translations are not allowed
* The Jaded Network: Japanese SFX
** http://thejadednetwork.com/sfx/search/
* Nihongo Resources: giongo/gitaigo (Japanese SFX) lookup
** http://www.nihongoresources.com/dictionaries/universal.html
** https://github.com/Pomax/nihongoresources.com/blob/master/giongo.txt
* Language Realm: Japanese slang
** http://www.languagerealm.com/japanese/japaneseslang.php
* Jisho: look up words and kanji
** https://jisho.org
** [b]Note:[/b] A modern JMdict/EDICT interface.
* Nihongo Master: expressions/phrases
** https://www.nihongomaster.com/dictionary
* Fuseiji: Helps with figuring out censored words [tn](i.e. when 〇 replaces a character)[/tn]
** http://fuseji.net

title: nice_knee_socks_day
body:
(Nice) Knee Socks Day, also called [b](Nice) Thighhighs Day[/b] or Nice Kneehighs Day, occurs on two dates: Nov 28th and Feb 8th.
These are used to celebrate [[thighhighs]]  and [[over-kneehighs|over-knee socks]]. Mostly this is equivalent with celebrating [[zettai ryouiki]], especially in the 2D realm.

 Thighhighs and over-knee socks are collectively called ニーハイ ([i]nihai[/i]) in Japanese; these dates were thus chosen as [[date pun|word play]]: Nov 28th => 1 ([i]ichi[/i]) - 1 ([i]ichi[/i]) - 2 ([i]ni[/i]) - 8 ([i]ha(ch)i[/i]) = [i]ii ni-hai[/i]; Feb 8th => 2 ([i]ni[/i]) - 8 ([i]ha(ch)i[/i]) = [i]ni-hai[/i]

Note that this day isn't about the legwear in English/on Danbooru called "kneehighs", since the term ニーハイ is only used in above sense of just-above-knee length (aka over-[i][b]kneehigh[/b][/i]) to mid-thigh socks, as a kind of "wasei-eigo":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wasei-eigo]. (Calf-/below-knee length socks are ハイソックス = [i]high socks[/i]. サイハイソックス = [i]thigh-high socks[/i] also exists, but only refers to socks that are almost leg length and thus have the appearance of tights (via the same logic as ニーハイソックス where the [i]high[/i] part is used to mean "cover"-length rather than "reach"-length), so they aren't usually counted for zettai ryouiki).

h4. See also

* [[Tag group:Holidays and celebrations]]

h4. External links

* "Pixiv Encyclopedia: いいニーハイの日":[https://dic.pixiv.net/a/いいニーハイの日]
* "Twitter: #いいニーハイの日":[https://twitter.com/hashtag/いいニーハイの日]
* "Twitter: #ニーハイの日":[https://twitter.com/hashtag/ニーハイの日]

title: sec-ops_(avatar)
body:
The military sector of the private corporation, the RDA (Resources Development Administration), who's responsible for all operations involving the moon of Pandora, located in the Alpha Centauri System. [spoilers]As such, they were the ones responsible for the destruction of the Omatikaya Clan Hometree, followed by their assault on the Tree of Souls[/spoilers] during the Pandoran War between the humans of the RDA and the [[Na'vi]].

Their forces are mostly made up of mercenaries and former soldiers (i.e. [[Jake Sully]]). Their vehicular arsenal includes [[mecha]]s and [[aircraft]] (most notably [[bicopter]]s). In the [[Avatar: The Way of Water|second movie]], it was expanded to include [[exoskeleton]]s, [[boat]]s, and [[submarine]]s.

h4. External links
* "Avatar Wiki":[https://james-camerons-avatar.fandom.com/wiki/Security_Operations]

title: imsa_gt_championship
body:
A now-defunct motorsports series under IMSA. Founded in 1969 and folded in 1999, the GT Championship was the original form of IMSA's main [[sports car]] racing league. The series was succeeded by the [[American Le Mans Series]], which itself is the predecessor of the current [[IMSA SportsCar Championship]]

Several Japanese platforms are notable for their success in this league, including the [[Mazda RX-7 FB|FB RX-7]] and [[Nissan 300ZX (Z32)|Z32 300ZX]].

It is set between the end of Kiminozo and the beginning of [[Muv-Luv]], and notably features much of the main cast from Muv-Luv Extra.

title: cobra_b.a.t.
body:
A fictional combat [[android]] from the [[G.I. JOE]] franchise.

The [b]Cobra B.A.T.[/b] ([i][b]B[/b]attle [b]A[/b]ndroid [b]T[/b]rooper[/i]) is an advanced and semi-autonomous [[robot]] [[soldier]], mass produced and employed by the [[Cobra Command]] [[terrorist]] organization.

The B.A.T.s are armed with a built-in [[arm cannon]] and a holstered sidearm. They carry several attachments for the arm cannon in their backpacks, such as a [[flamethrower]] add-on and a combat claw. 

The B.A.T.s are usually deployed in great numbers to provide disposable brute strength to the Cobra army. 

The [[action figure]] debuted in 1986 and became very popular. As of March 2014, there have been more than 24 figures in the 3 3/4-inch line of the G.I. Joe: A Real American Hero toyline, most released as either B.A.T. or Cobra B.A.T., one figure released as B.A.A.T. (Battle Armored Android Trooper) as part of the Star Brigade line, one figure released as Cobra Inferno B.A.T, and one figure released as Cobra Sky B.A.T.

h4. See also

* [[Crimson B.A.T.]]

body:
[i][[Addams Family]][/i] character. 

Daughter of [[Gomez Addams]] and [[Morticia Addams]], and generally the older sister to [[Pugsley Addams]]. In earlier continuities, she was somewhat cruel (especially to Puglsey), but mostly a cheerful and sweet little girl, but around the time of the 1990s film continuity her personality was canonized as a dour, cynical [[goth]]. 

This Wednesday has since become an icon for the goth community, and is the version that influenced the later [i][[Wednesday (netflix)|]][/i] characterization of her.

title: batting_stance
body:
A stance taken in [[baseball]] when the batter is up to bat. This stance involves holding the [[baseball bat|bat]] with [[two-handed|two hands]] and drawing the hands back, as the batter prepares to swing. The bat can be held up and back or parallel to the batter. Occasionally the batter will also lift a foot [[standing on one leg|off the ground]]. 

This stance can be performed with or without a [[baseball bat]].

h4. See Also
* [[fighting stance]]
* [[bunting (baseball)|]]
* [[batting cage]]
other_names: バッティングのかまえ

title: baseball_base
body: The bases of [[baseball]] are small plates, usually white and made of rubber, placed in a diamond shape around a [[baseball stadium|baseball field]]. There are four: first, second, third, and home base (sometimes called the "home plate"). A runner needs to touch every base from first to home without being tagged or forced out in order to score a home run. While the numerical bases are usually square, the home plate is in the shape of a pentagon.

title: pitching
body: In [[baseball]], pitching is the term referring to when the pitcher throws the [[baseball (object)|ball]] at the opposing team's batter, aiming to strike the batter out by delivering the ball to the [[catcher (baseball)|]] without letting the batter hit it. Typically this is done from atop the [[pitching mound]].

title: wheat
body: One of the major staple foods of the world, alongside [[rice]], [[corn]], [[potato]]es, and [[barley]]. The single most grown and traded food on the planet, almost every culture consumes wheat in some form. Most commonly prepared into [[flour]] before being baked into various [[bread]]s. Usually drawn as yellow [[wheat field]]s, before being harvested.

title: bunting_(baseball)
body: A batting technique in [[baseball]] which involves tapping the thrown [[baseball (object)|ball]] with the [[baseball bat|bat]] held horizontally instead of swinging normally. This results in a slower, closer ball that forces the fielding team into making a difficult defensive play.

title: catcher_(baseball)
body:
A defensive position in [[baseball]]. The catcher crouches behind the home plate to receive the balls thrown by the [[pitching|pitcher]]. The role of the catcher is to communicate with the pitcher in order to strike the batter out, secure the home plate from runners, and generally coordinate defensive plays. 

Due to the physical demands of the role, catchers wear extra protective equipment that other positions do not require. These include the [[catcher's mask]], the [[chest protector]], and [[shin guards]].

title: catcher's_mask
body: A [[mask]] used in [[baseball]] designed to protect the [[catcher (baseball)|]] from head and facial injuries due to their position on the field. The mask has a cage in the front which is held in place by a tough plastic rim. Older designs are worn over a brimless [[helmet]] or [[backwards hat|backwards]] [[baseball cap|cap]], but newer designs cover the top of the head as well. Bears some resemblance to the modern [[hockey mask]].

title: terrorist_(c&c:_generals)
body:
A unit in [[Command and Conquer: Generals]] that is known for its cost-effectiveness and ability to cause significant damage to enemy troops by detonating the [[explosive]] [[vest]] they wear, taking enemies along with them in a [[suicide]] attack. 

Due to censorship, the Terrorist was removed from the [[germany|German]] version of both Generals and Zero Hour and replaced by a [[bomb]] on wheels. Other than the visuals, however, the functionality is exactly the same. This version became very popular with the game's modding community. The Terrorist can also hijack civilian [[vehicle|vehicles]] to move faster, turning them into weaponized [[car|cars]].


h4. See Also
* [[Global Liberation Army]]
* [[Command and Conquer: Generals]]

title: global_liberation_army
body:
One of the three main factions that are playable in [[Command and Conquer: Generals]]. 

A violent movement and rogue state that serves as the main antagonist in the games' campaign. It is made up of various terrorist groups, revolutionaries, criminal organizations, and other movements opposed to imperialism, united under one banner. The GLA’s stated goal is to oppose the imperialism practiced by the [[united_states|United States of America]] and the [[china|People’s Republic of China]], and under the pretense of liberation, it seeks to dominate the world.

Due to its technological disadvantages compared to the two other factions, the GLA has comparatively weak ground vehicles and no air force, prompting it to use guerrilla tactics such as tunneling, suicide bombing, hijacking, and ambushes. 

The faction has gained notoriety and controversy for its parallels to Al-Qaeda, especially during the height of the War on Terror.

h4. See Also
* [[Command and Conquer: Generals]]

title: high-visibility_jacket
body:
A [[jacket]] with bright fluorescent colours in its natural property, such as neon [[green jacket|greenish]] [[yellow jacket|yellow]] or [[orange jacket|orange]] in order to make the wearer visible from any distance or light level.
In real life, it is commonly worn by [[police uniform|police]] officers in the UK.

h1. See also
* [[high-visibility vest]]
* [[Tag Group:Attire]]

title: autorefractor_test
body: A test that utilizes a machine called an autorefractor to provide a measurement of a person's refractive error. In other words, an automated version of a [[vision test]]. The patient looks into the autorefractor where they are shown an image, the most common being either a distant [[barn]] in a [[field]] or a distant [[hot air balloon]] at the end of a [[road]], and the image is focused until the patient can see it clearly. The images take advantage of [[vanishing point]]s to provide a sense of depth and appear [[round image|circular]] due to the lens in the machine.

title: traffic_barrier
body:
A barricade designed control the flow of vehicular or pedestrian traffic in a specified area.  Commonly used to keep vehicular traffic within the roadway or prevent them from hitting obstacles or running off steep slopes.  They're also used to bar entry, such as on blocking access to incomplete roads and bridges.  Such barriers are also used to protect pedestrians from vehicles, and may be placed to separate areas of high pedestrian traffic from vehicular traffic.

h4. Types

* [[Guard rail]]: 
** Flex-Beam/W-Beam: A long metal W-shaped beam of metal that runs alongside the road.
*** Example: post #5627306, post #6243008
** Thrie Beam: A long metal VVV-shaped beam of metal that runs alongside the road.
*** Example: post #5519007, post #6483822
** Cable barrier: A barrier composed of metal wires affixed to metal poles.
*** Example: post #2616332, 
** Pipe railing: A barrier composed of metal pipes.
*** Example: post #6577813, post #4563235
* Type I, II, & III traffic barricade: Styles of traffic barriers that use 1-3 reflective warning planks/sheets, the type refers to the number used.
** A-frame traffic barricade: A portable wood or plastic barricade made of two A-shaped end pieces and planks with reflective sheeting placed in-between.
*** Example: post #6164622, post #6405555, post #4171864 (Type II)
** Basic Type I-III:  May be portable and kept on t-legs or permanent posts embedded in the ground.
*** Example: post #6034006 (on left: Portable Type II), post #5254303 (Portable Type III)
* Traffic cones and bar: A small rod that affixes between two traffic cones, used to regulate pedestrian traffic .
** Example: post #6459980
* [[Jersey barrier]]: A modular concrete or plastic barrier.
** Example: post #5498800
* Traffic barrel: A large barrel or barrel-shaped portable barrier used as a larger version of a traffic cone to direct traffic or warn of hazards.
** Example: post #5288604, post #6089185
* [[bollard|Traffic bollard]] (barrier poles): Metal or concrete poles used to restrict vehicle access while allowing pedestrian access
** Example: post #5656419, post #554460, post #636645

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Traffic Barrier":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Traffic_barrier]
* "Wikipedia: Jersey barrier":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jersey_barrier]
* "Wikipedia: Cable barrier":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cable_barrier]

title: cz_805_bren
body:
A gas-operated [[assault rifle]] designed in 2009 and manufactured by Česká zbrojovka Uherský Brod. The modular design enables users to change the calibre to 5.56×45mm NATO or 7.62×39mm by quick change of barrel with gas tubes, breech block and magazine well.

The [b]CZ 805 BREN[/b] was created to supplant the Sa vz. 58 in the Czech Army, which later sprung some variants of this [[rifle]]; CZ 807, CZ BREN 2, CZ BREN 2 BR (7.62mm NATO [[battle rifle]]) and CZ BREN 2 PPS.
This tag covers all these variants and derivatives.

title: bioshock_1
body:
BioShock is a horror first-person shooter video game. Set in a biopunk, steampunk alternate history 1960, the game places the player in the role of a plane crash survivor named [[jack_(bioshock)|Jack]], who must explore the underwater city of Rapture, and survive attacks by the mutated beings and mechanical drones that populate it. The game incorporates elements found in role-playing and survival games, and is described by the developers as a "spiritual successor" to their previous titles in the System Shock series.

h4. Characters
* [[Jack (bioshock)|]]
* [[Big Daddy (bioshock)|]]
* [[Little Sister (bioshock)|]]

h4. See also

* [[BioShock 2]]
* Wikipedia entry: "BioShock":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/BioShock]

title: big_sister
body: In [[BioShock 2]], the Big Sisters are post-pubescent [[Little Sister (bioshock)|]]s that have become unstable in Rapture's environment. Ten years after the events of [[bioshock (series)|BioShock]], they are charged with maintaining the ecological balance in Rapture. The Big Sisters' designs are geared towards accommodating Little Sisters; they have a cage-like basket that is adorned with ribbons, which is used to safely carry Little Sisters on their backs, and childish doodles can be seen on their oxygen tanks.

title: little_sister_(bioshock)
body: In the [[bioshock (series)|BioShock]] series, Little Sisters are young girls who have been genetically altered and mentally conditioned to reclaim ADAM from the corpses around Rapture. Little Sisters are almost always accompanied by a [[Big Daddy (bioshock)|]].

title: panorama
body:
A wide-angle view of an area, broader than can be seen in one glance by the human eye. Typically produces a distorted image wherein some or all straight lines appear partially or completely curved, especially along the longer axis of the image.
External tools can be used to view these images properly.

If an image contains the full 360° view of an area, then also add the [[360_panorama]] tag.

title: tirpitz_(battle_of_titans)
body:
[b]R2H2 "Tirpitz"[/b] is a giant bipedal walker-style mech appeared in the game [[battle_of_titans|Battle of Titans]]. It is mounted with a double-barrel naval gun known as the "Inquisitor".

Has a rare Martian version (R2H2M1) of itself, coloured in black.

Its name references the [[tirpitz|German battleship Tirpitz]], though there is no canological relation between the two.
For its personification, not to be confused with [[tirpitz_(azur_lane)|Tirpitz (Azure Lane)]] and [[tirpitz_(warship_girls_r)|Tirpitz (Warship Girls R)]].

title: mite_(battle_of_titans)
body:
[b]R4L1 Mite[/b] is a quadruped [[mecha]] that appears in game [[battle_of_titans|Battle of Titans]].

Mite can perform a powerful jump, clinging onto any surface and climb them as if gravity does not exists. It is sometimes referred as a [[spider_tank]].

Has a skinned version known as the [i]Predator[/i].

title: wojtek
body:
Pronounced "voytek", Wojtek was an adopted bear cub that served the 22nd Artillery Company of Poland. To circumvent transportation rules prohibiting pets and mascot animals, Wojtek was officially drafted into the army- Complete with paycheck, dogtag ID, and personal record files. His work in carrying artillery crates during the Battle of Monte Casino earned him a promotion to Corporal, and a permanent presence in the 22nd Artillery Company's flag design.

Can be tagged if you see imagery depicting a bear carrying artillery shells, or by direct reference.

h4. External links
* Wikipedia: "Wojtek (bear)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wojtek_(bear)]

title: nelly_(battle_of_titans)
body:
[b]R6M4 Nelly[/b] is a [[mecha]] with six legs that appears in game [[battle_of_titans|Battle of Titans]]. It is a medium-class titan capable of mounting four light weapons. With its ability to jump, clings onto and climbs any surface, it is frequently acknowledged as a [[spider_tank]].

Has a rare Martian version (R6M4M1) of itself, coloured in black.

title: duplicate
body:
A post that is the same or inferior to an already existing post. This tag only applies to inferior posts that were uploaded [b]after[/b] an already existing identical post.

Duplicates should not be confused for the following:

* [[image sample]], an image typically used by sites to load images faster.
* [[md5 mismatch]], an post that has a different md5 from the file at the source.
* [[revision]], a post that has been revised by the artist from a previous version.
* [[variant set]], posts with a similar base, but non-trivial differences.
* [[scan]], a post that has been scanned from another source.

A few cases where the tag applies:

* Images with [[pixel-perfect duplicate|identical pixel data]], but different metadata.
* Lower resolution versions of the same post.
* [[Resized]] posts. Note that duplicate resized posts should not be tagged with [[md5 mismatch]].
* Images of generally lower quality; often a result of [[jpeg artifacts]].

Before you upload something, check if it has already been uploaded by using the "IQDB image search":http://danbooru.iqdb.org/ or the "Find similar" button.

Most duplicates are tagged manually; only [[pixel-perfect duplicate]]s are tagged automatically. There is no automated system in place to accurately tag non pixel-perfect duplicates given how easy it is to confuse them for the above (with the exception [[image sample]]s where the original is already uploaded).

h6. Notes:
* [b]Do not flag a duplicate post for deletion if your only reason is that the post is a duplicate.[/b]
* Don't add the duplicate tag on posts with visual differences ([[variant_set|variants]], [[revision|revisions]], [[textless version]]s etc.).
* Avoid uploading visually identical posts.
** Check for differences with "DuplicateBooru":https://duplicatebooru.zipfiled.info/ if you are unable to confirm with your own eyes.

h4. Related tags

Not to be confused with [[multiple sources]], although they may overlap sometimes.

* [[multiple sources]] is about outside sources -- it means that multiple copies are available outside Danbooru.
* [[duplicate]] is about Danbooru -- it means that we have multiple copies of the same image.

h4. See also

* [[help:upload]]
* [[help:image source]]

h4. External Links

* "How can I tell exactly what changed between two images?":[https://photo.stackexchange.com/a/11739]
* "Diffchecker":https://www.diffchecker.com/image-diff [tn]Online compare images[/tn]
* "ImageMagick":https://www.imagemagick.org/ [tn]Multitool with "compare":https://imagemagick.org/script/compare.php function[/tn]
* "XnView MP":https://www.xnview.com/en/xnviewmp [tn]Image viewer. Support EXIF, IPTC, XMP metadata[/tn]
* "ExifTool":https://exiftool.org/ [tn]Command-line application for work with metadata[/tn]

title: yamanbagiri_kunihiro
body:
Male personification of the sword [i]Yamanbagiri[/i] crafted by Horikawa Kunihiro. One of the five starter swords in [i][[Touken Ranbu]][/i]. Uchigatana-class.

The sword he is based on is actually a replica, as Nagao Akinaga, the lord of Ashikaga castle, requested a copy of the original [i]Yamanbagiri[/i]. In the game, this fact manifests itself in a massive inferiority complex concerning his replica status, and repeatedly devalues himself as a member of the saniwa's group. His happier lines are when he's doing fieldwork, as he feels that those are the only times where he can't be compared to the original [i]Yamanbagiri[/i]. Despite his negative self-opinion, he asserts himself as Kunihiro's "masterpiece".

Has [[blonde hair]] and [[aqua eyes]]. Wears a white [[hooded cloak]] and a [[open jacket]]ed [[suit]] with a [[blue necktie]]. By default, his clothes are somewhat [[torn_clothes|torn]]. His casual outfit is a red [[track suit]], and he still wears his cloak over it.

Seiyuu is Maeno Tomoaki. Character design is done by [[toichi (ik07)|Toichi]].

title: millia_jenius
body:
A fictional female humanoid [[alien]] character from the [[MACROSS]] franchise that first appeared in the [[Choujikuu Yousai Macross]] TV series from 1982. She also appears in the [[Macross: Do You Remember Love?]] movie adaptation, the [[Macross 7]] TV series and the [[Macross M3]] [[video game]].

[b]Millia Fallyna[/b] is a very skilled and dangerous, female [[Zentradi]] ([[Meltrandi]]) [[Quimeliquola]] [[Queadluun-Rau]] [[power armor]] ace pilot. Her nemesis is [[U.N. Spacy]] [[VF-1]] ace [[Maximilian Jenius]]. [spoilers]She is defeated in combat by Jenius, so she becomes a [[miclone]] spy and infiltrates the [[SDF-1]], intent on finding and killing the human pilot who defeated her several times. However, after confronting Max again and being spared by him she finally realizes her feelings of Max were not actually hatred, but love. After a brief time she marries Max, thus she adopts his second name and becomes [b]Millia Jenius[/b]. Then she joins the U.N. Spacy and becomes a VF-1 ace pilot herself.[/spoilers]

In the [i]Do You Remember Love[/i] anime film her name was changed to [b]Millia 639[/b] and in the [[Robotech]] western adaptation to [b][[Miriya]] Parina Sterling[/b].

h4. See also

* [[Dana Sterling]]

title: florence_nightingale_(fate)
body:
Berserker-class Servant in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. The eponymous "Angel of Crimea", a British nurse from the Victorian era best known for her contribution to the modern medical study and effort to improve the conditions in hospitals.

She has [[red eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] light [[pink hair]] worn in a [[braided ponytail]]. She wears a red [[military uniform]] with a [[black skirt]]. In her third Ascension level, she has a [[bandage over one eye]] and a [[black coat]] worn [[coat on shoulders|over her shoulders]].

Nightingale usually behaves in a cold and stoic manner. Due to the side effect of Madness Enchantment from her classification, she has an obsession with keeping anything clean or sanitized, and also causing her will to treat someone to go overboard, to the point that she will do anything to treat her patient, such as killing anyone who interrupts her treatment process.

She is designed by [[Takahashi Keitarou]] and voiced by [[Sawashiro Miyuki]].

title: dvalin_(genshin_impact)
body:
A character in [[Genshin Impact]].

Dvalin, also referred to as Stormterror, is a giant blue and turquoise dragon with six wings and two horns on its head. Dvalin has deep ties with Mondstadt and the Anemo Archon, once acting as one of Mondstadt's primary guardians.

Early in the story, two purple spikes are present on the back of Dvalin's neck. [spoiler]These spikes are the corrupted blood of the dragon [[durin (genshin impact)|Durin]], who Dvalin defeated hundreds of years ago. These spikes are removed by the player in the first arc of the game.[/spoiler]

title: katou_keiko
body:
Witch of the Fuso Army in the [[Witches Of Africa]].

Her appearance is tomboyish, with short brown hair and often seen with goggles worn on her head. She was sent to North Africa and soon joined with [[Hanna-Justina Marseille]]'s unit, forming the 31st Joint Fighter Squadron "Storm Witches". Being the ranking officer, Keiko became the Commanding Officer. She has the power of super eyesight, but due to her age and failing magic, Keiko mostly holds herself to an aerial recon role with her camera.

Has the pet name 'Kei'. Her weapons include [[arisaka|Type 38]], Type 97, and Type 98 rifles, Type 1 and ZB-26 machine guns,  and a M1934 pistol. Her familiar is the Ezo red fox, and she's based on Katou Shouiji.

title: battle_of_the_kerch_peninsula
body:
[b]The Battle of the Kerch Peninsula[/b], which commenced with the [[Soviet]] Kerch-Feodosia Landing Operation (Russian: Керченско-Феодосийская десантная операция, [i]Kerchensko-Feodosiyskaya desantnaya operatsiya[/i]) and ended with the [[germany|German]] Operation "Bustard Hunt" (German: Unternehmen Trappenjagd), was a [[World War II]] [[battle]] between "Erich von Manstein":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Erich_von_Manstein 's German [[Wehrmacht]] and [[Romania]]n 11th Army and the Soviet Crimean Front forces in the Kerch Peninsula, in the eastern part of the Crimean Peninsula. 

It began on 26 December 1941, with an amphibious landing operation by two Soviet armies intended to break the [[Siege of Sevastopol]]. Axis forces first contained the Soviet beachhead throughout the winter and interdicted its naval supply lines through aerial bombing. From January through April, the Crimean Front launched repeated offensives against the 11th Army, all of which failed with heavy losses. The Red Army lost 352,000 men in the attacks, while the Axis suffered 24,120 casualties. Superior German artillery firepower was largely responsible for the Soviet debacle.

On 8 May 1942, the Axis struck with great force in a major counteroffensive codenamed Trappenjagd which concluded by around 19 May 1942 with the liquidation of the Soviet defending forces and [[victory]] for the Wehrmacht.

title: siege_of_odessa
body:
[b]The Siege of Odessa[/b], also known to the [[Soviet]]s as [b]The Defense of Odessa[/b], lasted from 8 August until 16 October 1941, during the early phase of "Operation Barbarossa":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Barbarossa , the Axis invasion of the [[Soviet Union]] during [[World War II]].

Odessa was a port on the Black Sea in the Ukrainian SSR. On 22 June 1941, the Axis powers invaded the Soviet Union. In August, Odessa became a target of the [[Romania]]n 4th Army and elements of the German 11th Army. 

Due to the heavy resistance of the Soviet 9th Independent Army and the rapidly formed Separate Coastal Army, supported by the Black Sea Fleet, it took the Axis forces 73 days of siege and four assaults to take the city. Romanian forces suffered 93,000 casualties, against Red Army casualties estimated to be between 41,000 and 60,000.

The siege ended in a costly Axis victory, but the [[soviet_army|Red Army troops]] succesfully evacuated the region.
